snippet: So many apps came out for the iPad last year that it was easy to miss the good ones. Here are 10 favorites.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column features the top 10 iPad apps of 2011.

headline.main: Sorting Out an Avalanche of iPad Apps for the Best of 2011
headline.print_headline: Sorting Out an Avalanche of iPad Apps for the Best of 2011

snippet: Next week's annual Consumer Electronics Show, one of the largest technology conventions in the country, will see an unusual shortage of carriers in keynote roles. In general, big trade shows do not seem to have the pull they once did.
abstract: Next week's annual Consumer Electronics Show, one of the largest technology conventions in the country, will see an unusual shortage of carriers in keynote roles. In general, big trade shows do not seem to have the pull they once did.

headline.main: Cell Carriers Show Little Interest in C.E.S.

snippet: Analysts think Amazon.com could be ready to move beyond its cloud services businesses -- renting data storage and raw computing power -- and add analysis software that can be rented, and possibly modified, to suit a company's needs. It would not b...
abstract: Analysts think Amazon.com could be ready to move beyond its cloud services businesses -- renting data storage and raw computing power -- and add analysis software that can be rented, and possibly modified, to suit a company's needs. It would not be difficult for Amazon to offer such a service since many of its major products are already on Amazon Web Services.

headline.main: Will Amazon Offer Analytics as a Service?
headline.print_headline: Amazon Expected To Start Offering Data Analytics

snippet: Thanks to a computer-savvy young generation and a high level of disposable income, the Middle East is seen as a booming market for both creative talent and potential video-game buyers.

headline.main: Making a Play for Video Gamers
headline.print_headline: Making a Play for Video Gamers

snippet: Roku, one of the earliest makers of a box for streaming Internet video to televisions, is developing a product that lets people watch Web video without a box. The product, the Roku Streaming Stick, slips unobtrusively into an HDMI jack on the back...
abstract: Roku, one of the earliest makers of a box for streaming Internet video to televisions, is developing a product that lets people watch Web video without a box. The product, the Roku Streaming Stick, slips unobtrusively into an HDMI jack on the back of a TV.

headline.main: Roku Looks Beyond the Set-Top Box

snippet: Teachers in Idaho and elsewhere have been in revolt over policy makers thrusting technology into classrooms and shifting money to unproven teaching methods.

headline.main: Teachers Resist High-Tech Push in Idaho Schools
headline.print_headline: Teachers Resist High-Tech Push In Idaho Schools

snippet: Henry Alford’s new book is a whimsical game of tiddlywinks played on the minefield of good manners.
abstract: Charles Isherwood reviews book Would It Kill You to Stop Doing That?: A Modern Guide to Manners by Henry Alford.

headline.main: How to Avoid Potholes on the Road to Politeness
headline.print_headline: How to Avoid Potholes On the Road to Politeness
